intro: Erigeron pumilus subsp. concinnoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and prairies, and it thrives in full sun. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. The species is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
